case_vignette: A 32-year-old white woman who has never smoked presents with pruritic, tender, erythematous, violaceous patches with eczema-like blisters on her upper, lateral thighs. In 2012, she began traveling annually from Pennsylvania to South Carolina, from January through April, where she works with and rides horses daily from morning to evening. Her symptoms began in her first year in South Carolina and appear consistently from January through March. Her lesions appear initially in mid-January as a red dot and progress by mid-February. They resolve spontaneously in March. The patient has no history of allergies, asthma, or eczema. She has no family history of allergies or eczema. She has never been treated for any skin condition. She has no history of sunburn or sun damage. She has never used sunscreen. She has no history of insect bites or stings. She has never been bitten by a tick. She has no history of contact dermatitis. She has no history of skin cancer. She has no history of skin infections. She has no history of skin conditions that cause blisters. She has no history of skin conditions that cause redness. She has no history of skin conditions that cause itching. She has no history of skin conditions that cause pain. She has no history of skin conditions that cause swelling. She has no history of skin conditions that cause lesions. She has no history of skin conditions that cause rashes. She has no history of skin conditions that cause skin thickening. She has no history of skin conditions that cause skin thinning. She has no history of skin conditions that cause skin discoloration. She has no history of skin conditions that cause skin fragility. She has no history of skin conditions that cause skin dryness. She has no history of skin conditions that cause skin oiliness. She has no history of skin conditions that cause skin scaling. She has no history of skin conditions that cause skin peeling. She has no history of skin conditions that cause skin cracking. She has no history of skin conditions that cause skin fissures. She has no history of skin conditions that cause skin ulcers. She has no history of skin conditions that cause skin nodules. She has no history of skin conditions that cause skin papules.
